9.06 - PARKS, SCHOOL SITES, AND PUBLIC AREAS
A. Where a proposed public park or playground and other publicuse
areas, as determined by the Plan Commission and the President
and Board of Trustees, is located in whole or in part
within a subdivision, the subdivider shall make available
such lands to the Village of Itasca -- provided, however,
that the total dedication (exclusive of public streets,
alleys, and pedestrian ways) shall not exceed ten "(10) percent
of the total gross acreage owned or controlled by the
subdivider. Where an area that is specifically designated
by the President and Board of Trustees for a public park or
playground and other public use exceeds the area equivalent
to ten (10) percent of the area of the total acreage owned
by the subdivider, the entire ~rea shall be reserved for such
use on all subdivision plans and plats; and the acquisition of
such additional area shall then be secured by the Village of
Itasca or arrangement made for its acquisition within a period
not to exceed three (3) years from the date of approval of
the preliminary plan. The value of the subject land in excess
of ten (10) percent, shall be established by three (3) qualified
appraisers, one (1) of whom. whall be appointed by the
Plan Commission; one (1) by the subdivider; and one (1) of
whom shall be mutually agreed upon by the other two (2).
B. Where less than ten (10) percent of the total gross area being
subdivided is proposed for public parks, playgrounds, or other
public use areas, as designated by the Plan Commission and
the President and Board of Trustees, the subdivider shall dedicate
such area that is less than ten (10) percent and, in addition,
pay to the Village of Itasca a sum of money so that either
or both the dedication and the payment equal to ten (10) percent
of the "fair market value" of improved land.*
C. The entire sum of money equal to the "fair market value'' of*
improved land comprising an area equivalent to ten (10) percent
of the total area of the tract shall be paid by the owner
or subdivider to the Village of Itasca in the event that there
are no public open spaces required by the Plan Commissi~n and
the President and Board of Trustees.
D. Sums of money so received by the Village of Itasca shall be
placed in a special fund to be known as the PUBLIC LAND PURCHASE
AND IMPROVEMENT FUND, and allocated by the Presic=nt
and Board of Trustees solely for purchase of land for p~blic
parks or playgrounds and other public areas.

SECTION 10.0u - ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT
10.0l - ORGANIZATION
The following offices of the government of the Village of Itasca are i:o·ncerned
with the administration of this Ordinance.
A. The Village Board. The Village Board is vested with the following
responsibilities in regard to subdivision control:
1. Plats. Approval or disapproval of all final plats referred to it
by the Plan Commission.
2. Variations. Approval or disapproval of all variations and
exceptions recommended by the Plan Commission.
3. Amendments. l>Jnendment of the regulations of this Ordinance when
found necessary and desirable after review by the Plan
Commission.
4. Enforcement. Ini ti at ion of appropriate proceeding to enforce the
provisions of this Ordinance.
B. The Village Engineer.
c.
l. Review of Plats. The Village Enginee'r shall review all
preliminary subdivision plans and make detenninations in the
areas of design standards and engineering specifications, as
stipulated herein.
2. Inspection of Work. The Village Engineer shall inspect all
improvements required by this Ordinance both during construction
and after completion to insure compliance with this Ordinance and
with good construction practice.
3. Conflict of Interest. The Village Engineer shall not be retained
by a subdivider or other interested party to perform engineering
work in any subdivision subject to the app1 ication of this
Ordinance.
The Village Plan Commission.
provisions of this Ordinance,
sila 11:
The Plan Commission shall administer the
and in furtherance of said authority
l. Maintain Ordinance. Maintain permanent and current records cf
this Ordinance, including amendments thereto.
2. File Plans and Plats. Receive and file all preli.~inary plans and
final plats Ltogether with applications).
77.
3. Liaison with Concerned Agencies. Forward copies of the
preliminary plan to the President of the Village Board and other
appropriate offices and agencies for their recommendations and
report.
4. Preliminary Plans. Approve or disapprove of all preliminary
plans.
5. Liaison with Village Board. Forward decisions made on all
preliminary plans to the Village Board.
ti. File all Checked Plats. Receive and file all final plats, and
check their compliance with the preliminary plan.
7. Forward Plats to Villaoe Board. Forward with recommendations to
the Village Board all final plats.
8. ·Other Determinations. Make all other determinations required by
the regulations herein.
D. The Village Clerk.
1. Recording. The Village Clerk shall record the final plat with ·
the Cook or Du Page County Recorder within two (2) months.
2. Recording, local. The Village Clerk shall file for local record,
the final plat in exact form as approved by the Village Board,
·and as filed with the Cook or Ou Page County Recorder.
10.02 - ENFORCEMENT
A. Plat Officer to Administer Ordinance. ·The Chairman of the Plan
Commission designated as Plat Officer shall administer this Ordinance
and bring any violations or lack of compliance here,;itil to the
attention of the Village President.
B. Compliance Required Before Sale of Lots or Issuance of Building
Permit. No owner or agent of the owner, of any parcel of land located
in a proposed subdivision shall transfer or sell such parcel, nor
shall any public official issue a building permit for the construction
of buildings or structures within a proposed subdivision, before the
final plat of ;aid subdivision has been approved bJ the Village Board,
in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and filed with the
Recorder of Deeds of Cook or Du Page Counties, Illinois.
78.
C. Use of Metes and Bounds Measure Prohibited. The subdivision of any
lot or any parcel of land by the use of metes and bounds for the
purp.:>se of sale, transfer, or lease with the intent of evading this
Ordinance wi11 not be pennitted. All such described subdivisions
shall be subject to all of the requirements and regulations co·ntained
in this Ordinance. ·
D. Compliance Required Before Plat Approval. No final plat of
subdivision shall be approved which does not comply with all the
provisions of this Ordinance.
10.03 - . VARIATIONS AND EXCEPTIONS
A. Hardships. Where the Plan Commission finds that extraordinary
hardships or particular difficulties regarding the physical
development of land may result from strict compliance with these
regulations, it may recommend variations or exceptions to the
regulations so tht substantial justice may be done and the pub1ic
interest secured, provided the Plan Commission shall not recommend
variations or exception to the regulation of this Ordinance unless it
shall make findings based upon the evidence presented to it in each
specific case that:
1. Public Welfare Protected. The granting of the variation will not
be detrimental to .the public safety, health, or welfare or ·
injurious to other property or improvements in the nei~hborhood
in which the property is located.
2. Unique Conditions. The conditions upon which the request for a
variation is based are unique to the property for which the
variation is sought and are not applicable, generally, to other
property; and
3. Particular Physical Conditions. Because of the particular
physical surroundings, shape or topographical conditions of the
specific property involved, a particular hardship to the owner
would result, as distinguished from a mere inconvenience, if the
strict letter of the regulations were carried out.
B. Conditions. In recommending variations and exceptions, the Plan
Commission may require such conditions as will, in its judgement,
secure substantially the objectives of the standards or requireme;,ts
of this Ordinance.
C. Procedure. A petition for any such variance shall be submitted in
writing by the subdivider ·at the time the preliminary plan is fil~d
for consideration by the Plan Commission. The petition shall state
fully the grounds for the application and all of the fact relied upon
by the petitioner.
7':J.
I
D. Recommendations. Such variations and exceptions as may be recommended
by the Plan Commission shall be forwarded to the Village Board in
writing substantiating the recommended variations and/or exceptions .
.. rt!.e. Village Board may approve such.variations or exception~- from the
··requirements of this Ordinance in specific cases as listed on the
final plat, which in its opinion do not adversely affect the adopted
Comprehensive Plan or the intent and purpose of this Ordinance.
10.04 - RECORD OF PLATS
All of such plats of subdivision, after the same have been submitted and
approved as provided in this Ordinance, shall be copied upon a book of
piats of said Village of Itasca and shall be filed and kept by the Village
Clerk of the Village of Itasca.
10.05 - VALIDITY
".. .
If any iection, subsectio~. sentence; clause, or.phrase of this ·ordinance
is adjudged to be void, such decision shall not affect the validi.ty o_f the
remaining portions of this Ordinance.
10 .06 APPEALS
Any person or corporation may appeal within sixty (60j days to the Village
·Board any final action taken by the Plan Commission. The Village Board
shall act as a Board of Appeals and shall hear and decide appeals from and
review any final order, requirement, decision or determination made by the
Pian Commission, under this Subdivision ~ontrol Ordinance. The concurring
vote of the majority of Trustees present shall be necessary to reverse any
final order of the Plan Commission under this Ordinance.
10.07 - REPEAL
All ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict with the prov1s1ons of
this Ordinance are, to the extent that such conflict exists, hereby
re pea 1 ed.
80.
10. 08 - AMENDMENTS
For the purpose of promoting the health, safety, and general welfare, the
Vil 1 age Board may from time to time amend the regulations imposed by this
Ordinance. The Plan Commission may consider proposed amendments.and make
recommendations thereon to the Village Board.
10.09 - VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES
Any person, firm, or corporation who fails to comply with, or violates, any
of the provisions of this Ordinance, shall be subject to a fine of not less
than one hundred ($100.00) dollars and not more than five hundred ($500.UO/
dollars; and each day the violation continues shall be considered a
separate offense.
Whoever shall sell or offer fur sale, lease or offer for lease, while this
Ordinance is in effect, an1 lot or lots or block or blocks, within the
incorporated limits of the Village of Itasca, or any subdivision of any lot
or block therein, or within contiguous territory and not more than one and
one-half (l-l/2i miles beyond the incorporated boundary of the Village of
Itasca before a Final Plat of Subdivision has been approved by the Plan
Commission and the Village as r.equired bJ this Ordinance, shall be fined
not less than twenty-five ($25.00) dollars nor more than five hundred
($500.00) dollars for each lot, block, or part tpereof so disposed of,
offered for sale, or leased.
10.10 - FEES
A. Fee Schedule for Planning Review. See Resolution No.~~~~-
b. Recording Fees. Jn addition to the fees listed in Resolution No.~,
the subdivider shall also bear the cost of recording the plat.
10.ll - PUBLIC UTILIT!t::S PERMITS
Public utilities sha11 obtain permits from the Vi11age Board for the
installation of communications, electric power, gas, or other utility
servic~s before any installation work is started.
10.12 - ADOPTION
This Ordinance shall be in full force and effect from and after its
passage, approval, and publication as required by law.
81.

10.13 - PUBLICATION
This Ordinance· shall be published in book, or pamphlet form as provided by the
!11 inois Municipal Code.
10.14 - EFFECT
This Ordinance shall be in full force and effect upon its approval,' passage
and publication according to law.
